title: Ticket #3565: mmap'ing in a standard universe job crashes the shadow
description:
If a standard universe job calls mmap, the shadow crashes with

04/08/13 09:42:53 (23559697.0) (22450):ERROR "Assertion ERROR on (syscall_sock->end_of_message())" at line 3803 in file /slots/01/dir_7267/userdir/src/condor_syscall_lib/receivers.cpp

After which the job goes to Idle and the process repeats itself.

Note that mmap isn't supported in standard universe, and the code is trying to return ENOSYS, but the client hangs up earlier than expected.
remarks:
2013-May-13 13:04:36 by tlmiller:
Investigation revealed two problems:

(1) The direct cause of the crash was code( void * ) being unimplemented (and empty messages, by default, not being allowed). Implementing this function eliminated the crash. However,

(2) The code generator only sets errno in the job for functions which return (void) pointers if that pointer is NULL... and (void *)-1 is a legal error value for mmap().

One possibility is to check in the mmap() switch if the remote syscal returned -1 and assume it only does so for E_NOSYS. (This is currently true -- if the remote syscall is made at all, it always returns -1 and ENOSYS.)

However, it appears that the only thing the remote syscall does is log the fact the call to mmap() failed, via CONDOR_NotSupported() calling job_report_store_error(). This 'job report' appears to be accessible only via the notification e-mail. This suggests it wouldn't be much of a loss simply to handle mmap() entirely within the job.

2013-May-15 13:25:21 by tlmiller:
It doesn't look as hard as I thought it would to write custom senders/receivers (especially with the generated code to start from), so I'm just fixing those to check for MAP_FAILED instead of NULL for mmap().

2013-May-16 09:30:07 by gthain:
Todd:

How about we make this a reinterpret_cast to make it clearer what's going on, and then you can push it to master.

2013-May-16 16:47:02 by tlmiller:
Done.
